item.title: 早间竞标人工智能可能还没完
item.description: Tom Westbrook 展望欧洲和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Tom Westbrook】

item.title: 美国关税可能使日本陷入六个季度以来的首次经济萎缩：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社周五的一项民意调查显示，在受到美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税政策打击后，日本经济在7-9月份可能出现了六个季度以来的首次萎缩。【原文：Japan's economy probably contracted for the first time in six quarters in the July-September period after being battered by U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff policies, a Reuters poll showed on Friday.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：面对美国和大型科技公司的压力，欧盟权衡暂停具有里程碑意义的人工智能法案的部分内容
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周五报道，在大型科技公司和美国政府的强大压力下，欧盟委员会正在提议暂停实施其具有里程碑意义的人工智能法律的部分内容。【原文：The European Commission is proposing a pause to parts of its landmark artificial intelligence laws amid intense pressure from big tech companies and the U.S. government, Financial Times reported on Friday.】

item.title: 西太平洋银行不会就裁员失利提起上诉
item.description: 澳大利亚西太平洋银行（Westpac）的一位发言人表示，该行在强制一名员工每周两次到办公室上班的案件中败诉，因此不会对劳工法庭的裁决提起上诉。【原文：Australian bank Westpac will not appeal a labour tribunal ruling after it lost a case to compel one of its workers to be in the office twice a week, according to a bank spokesperson.】

item.title: 日本投资者因对美联储言论和估值担忧持谨慎态度而抛售外国股票
item.description: 截至11月1日的一周内，日本投资者大量减持外国股票，因为他们在美国联邦储备委员会一些官员发表鹰派言论后转为谨慎，并倾向于在近期市场反弹后锁定利润。【原文：Japanese investors divested significant holdings in foreign stocks in the week to November 1, as they turned cautious amid hawkish remarks from some U.S. Federal Reserve officials and favoured locking in profits after the recent market rally.】

item.title: 日本财务大臣表示，日本政府将支持大银行发行稳定币的项目
item.description: 日本财务大臣片山聪树周五表示，日本金融厅已决定支持日本三大银行联合发行稳定币的项目。【原文：Japan's Financial Services Agency has decided to support a project by the country's three largest banks to jointly issue stablecoins, Finance Minister Satsuki Katayama said on Friday.】

item.title: 新加坡电信出售约 12 亿美元的印度巴帝电信股份
item.description: 新加坡电信公司（Singapore Telecommunications）周五表示，该公司以 15 亿新元（11.6 亿美元）的价格出售了印度第二大移动运营商 Bharti Airtel 0.8% 的股份。【原文：Singapore Telecommunications said on Friday its unit sold a 0.8% stake in India's second-largest mobile carrier Bharti Airtel for S$1.5 billion ($1.16 billion).】

item.title: 日本首相高市让大手大脚的拥护者担任小组成员
item.description: 日本主张扩张性财政政策的通货再膨胀主义者在经济决策中卷土重来，其中一些人被首相高市真奈钦点担任政府重要部门的职务。【原文：Japan's reflationist advocates of expansionary fiscal policy are making a comeback in economic decision-making with some hand-picked by Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi to fill posts in key government panels.】

item.title: Downdetector 显示，约 15,000 名用户的 Apple TV 出现故障
item.description: 据故障跟踪网站 Downdetector.com 称，周四美国有近 14907 名用户的苹果流媒体服务 Apple TV 出现故障。【原文：Apple's streaming service Apple TV was down for nearly 14,907 users in the U.S. on Thursday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.】

item.title: 全球贸易压力增大，中国出口意外下滑至2月以来最差水平
item.description: 中国 10 月份的出口出人意料地下滑，原因是海外订单减少，而此前几个月，中国为抵御美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的关税而采取了前置措施。【原文：China's exports unexpectedly slumped in October as overseas orders tapered off following months of front-loading to beat President Donald Trump's tariffs, and as buyers watched to see how a volatile month in U.S.-China trade ties would play out.】

item.title: 特朗普称美国与乌兹别克斯坦达成贸易协议
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）周四表示，美国和乌兹别克斯坦已达成经贸协议，乌兹别克斯坦计划在未来三年内采购和投资350亿美元，在未来十年内采购和投资超过1000亿美元，用于美国的一些行业。【原文：The United States and Uzbekistan have reached a trade and economic deal, President Donald Trump said on Thursday, stating that Uzbekistan plans to purchase and invest $35 billion in the next three years and more than $100 billion in the next 10 years in some U.S. sectors.】

item.title: 供应忧虑加重，石油将迎来第二周下跌
item.description: 由于担心供应过剩和美国需求放缓，石油价格在连续三天下跌后于周五略有回升，但似乎将迎来第二周的下跌。【原文：Oil edged up on Friday following three days of declines on worries about excess supply and slowing demand in the U.S., though prices appeared to be headed for a second week of losses.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，美国将阻止英伟达向中国出售缩小版人工智能芯片
item.description: 据《The Information》周四援引三位熟悉内情的人士的话报道，白宫已通知其他联邦机构，不允许英伟达向中国出售其最新的缩小版人工智能芯片。【原文：The White House has informed other federal agencies that it will not permit Nvidia to sell its latest scaled-down AI chips to China, The Information reported on Thursday, citing three people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 低迷情绪令科技股周线下跌
item.description: 周五，由于投资者对人工智能股的涨势感到不安，科技股市场迎来了七个月来最严重的单周跌幅，而债券和日元等更安全的资产则走高。【原文：Tech-heavy stock markets were bracing for their heaviest weekly falls in seven months on Friday as investors have turned uneasy about how far the rally in artificial intelligence stocks has run, while safer assets such as bonds and the yen went higher.】

item.title: 马斯克计划建立特斯拉超大型人工智能芯片工厂，并考虑与英特尔建立潜在合作关系
item.description: 首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周四表示，特斯拉可能需要建造 "一座巨大的芯片工厂 "来生产人工智能芯片，并公开表示这家电动汽车制造商可以与英特尔合作。【原文：CEO Elon Musk on Thursday said Tesla probably will have to build "a gigantic chip fab" to make artificial intelligence chips and publicly mused the EV maker could work with Intel.】

item.title: 数据显示美国就业市场出现裂痕，美元处于守势
item.description: 周五亚洲早盘，美元回落，领跌主要货币，原因是缺乏美国劳动力市场官方数据的投资者抓住了私营部门调查疲软的迹象。【原文：The dollar retreated in early Asia trade on Friday, leading declines among major currencies as investors lacking official data on the U.S. labour market seized upon signs of weakness in private sector surveys.】

item.title: 美国敲定周五开始削减国内航班 4
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局周四以政府停摆期间空中交通管制的安全问题为由，命令航空公司从美国东部时间周五上午6点（格林尼治标准时间11点）开始将40个高流量机场的国内航班运营削减4%。【原文：The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration on Thursday ordered airlines to cut domestic flight operations by 4% at 40 high-traffic airports starting at 6 a.m. ET (1100 GMT) on Friday, citing safety concerns about air traffic control during the government shutdown.】

item.title: 哈弗分析公司预计美国每周申请失业救济人数温和增长
item.description: 哈弗分析公司（Haver Analytics）周四估计，上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数略有增加，表明尽管宣布的裁员人数激增，但10月份劳动力市场状况稳定。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits increased marginally last week, Haver Analytics estimated on Thursday, pointing to stable labor market conditions in October despite a surge in announced layoffs.】

item.title: 哪些机场受到美国强制削减航班的影响？
item.description: 据路透社看到的一份文件显示，美国联邦航空管理局周四告诉各航空公司，从周五开始在 40 个客流量大的机场削减 4% 的航班。【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration told airlines on Thursday to cut 4% of flights at 40 high-traffic airports starting Friday, according to a document seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 汽车制造商 Stellantis 终止与澳大利亚 Alliance Nickel 的供应协议
item.description: 澳大利亚联盟镍业公司（Alliance Nickel）周五表示，汽车制造商 Stellantis 将终止他们从 NiWest 项目供应电池级镍和钴的交易，该交易将于 12 月 3 日生效，理由是错过了里程碑期限。【原文：Australia's Alliance Nickel said on Friday carmaker Stellantis will terminate their supply deal for battery-grade nickel and cobalt from the NiWest project, effective December 3, citing missed milestone deadlines.】

item.title: 暂停港口收费，特朗普政府寻求与中国就航运问题进行谈判
item.description: 特朗普政府周四表示，将就中国在造船业和海洋物流业的主导地位问题与中国进行谈判，同时正式计划暂停向与中国有联系的船只征收为期一年的美国港口费，作为缓解贸易紧张局势的更广泛协议的一部分。【原文：The Trump administration said on Thursday it would pursue negotiations with China over its dominance of shipbuilding and ocean logistics as it formalized plans for a one-year pause on U.S. port fees on China-linked vessels as part of a broader deal to reduce trade tensions.】

item.title: 穆萨莱姆：美联储降息支持就业市场是正确的
item.description: 圣路易斯联邦储备银行行长阿尔贝托-穆萨莱姆（Alberto Musalem）周四表示，美国央行降息以帮助就业市场是正确的。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President Alberto Musalem said on Thursday the U.S. central bank has been right to cut interest rates to help the job market.】

item.title: 高盛晋升总经理的高管人数为 2021 年以来最多
item.description: 华尔街贷款公司高盛（Goldman Sachs）在一份公司备忘录中表示，明年将有 638 名高管晋升为董事总经理，这是自 2021 年以来的最高值，因为该银行受益于整个行业投资银行业务的回暖。【原文：Wall Street lender Goldman Sachs will promote 638 executives to managing director next year, the highest since 2021, a company memo said, as the bank benefits from a pickup in investment banking across the industry.】

item.title: 澳航上半年国内收入下滑，原因是非资源企业需求放缓
item.description: 澳大利亚航空公司（Qantas Airways）周五表示，由于非资源型企业客户的需求低于预期，该公司预计2026财年上半年的国内业务收入将处于预测区间的下限。【原文：Australia's Qantas Airways said on Friday it expects domestic unit revenue for the first half of fiscal 2026 to land at the lower end of its forecast range, citing weaker-than-anticipated demand from non-resource corporate clients.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司第三季度净利润增长 2.7
item.description: 巴西国营石油公司（Petrobras）周四公布，第三季度净利润为 60.3 亿美元，与去年同期相比增长 2.7%。【原文：Brazilian state-run oil firm Petrobras on Thursday posted a $6.03 billion net profit for the third-quarter, a 2.7% increase when compared to the same period a year earlier.】

item.title: 美国国家运输安全委员会称，UPS飞机坠毁调查将调查维修历史
item.description: 美国安全调查人员周四表示，他们正在调查 UPS 一架货机的维修历史，这架飞机周二在肯塔基州路易斯维尔坠毁，造成至少 13 人死亡。【原文：U.S. safety investigators said on Thursday they are probing the maintenance history of a UPS cargo plane that was in Texas for repairs weeks before crashing in flames in Louisville, Kentucky, on Tuesday, killing at least 13 people.】

item.title: 受库存清理影响，Microchip 预计季度净销售额低于预期
item.description: 微芯科技公司（Microchip Technology）周四预测第三季度净销售额低于华尔街预期，表明随着汽车和工业市场客户继续清理过剩库存，对其芯片的需求不温不火。【原文：Microchip Technology forecast third-quarter net sales below Wall Street estimates on Thursday, indicating tepid demand for its chips as customers in the automotive and industrial markets continue to clear excess inventory.】

item.title: Monster Beverage 因无糖能量饮料需求强劲，季度业绩超出预期
item.description: 怪兽饮料公司（Monster Beverage）周四公布的第三季度营收和利润超出华尔街预期，这主要得益于无糖能量饮料和新口味饮料在经济不确定的情况下仍保持强劲的需求。【原文：Monster Beverage beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter revenue and profit on Thursday, helped by resilient demand for its sugar-free energy drinks and new flavors even amid economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 交易日 不确定性抨击风险偏好
item.description: 美国股市、债券收益率和美元周四全线下跌，原因是市场再次担心人工智能泡沫和对美国劳动力市场强劲程度的担忧。【原文：U.S. stocks, bond yields and the dollar all fell on Thursday, dragged down by renewed fears of an AI bubble and worries over the strength of the U.S. labor market.】

item.title: 特斯拉股东批准伊隆-马斯克 8,780 亿美元薪酬计划
item.description: 特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周四大获全胜，股东们批准了未来十年高达 8,780 亿美元的薪酬方案，支持他将这家电动汽车制造商打造成人工智能和机器人巨头的愿景。【原文：Tesla CEO Elon Musk scored a resounding victory on Thursday as shareholders approved a pay package of as much as $878 billion over the next decade, endorsing his vision of morphing the EV maker into an AI and robotics juggernaut.】
